description: From Middle English blak, blac (“pale”), from Old English blāc (“pale, pallid, wan, livid; bright, shining, glittering, flashing”) and Old Norse bleikr (“pale; yellow, pink; any non-red warm color”); both from Proto-Germanic *blaikaz (“pale; shining”). Compare Scots bleg (“light, drab”). More at bleak.

adjectives.description: blake (comparative blaker or more blake, superlative blakest or most blake) (UK dialectal, Northern England, poetic)

entries.meaning: Pale, pallid; wan; sallow; of a sickly hue.
